25 Oct 2024

6 New Literary Fiction Novels to Remind You It’s Never Too Late

In a world that often feels rushed, these six new literary fiction novels beautifully capture the essence of timing and transformation. Each story reminds us that it’s never too late to pursue dreams, find love, or redefine ourselves. With rich prose and compelling characters, these books will inspire you to embrace life’s possibilities at any age. Dive in and discover narratives that resonate with hope and renewal!

We Are Made

by John Ludlam

Release Date: October 16 2024

London, 1938. William is grieving over his former teacher, killed fighting for the Republicans in Spain. As Europe slides towards war, William is supporting his family by working in a factory manufacturing Spitfire parts. He bumps into Elizabeth, an old school friend, and soon he’s falling in love – but Elizabeth is no longer the girl he remembers.

Buy on Amazon

The World Happiness Organisation

by Lou Gibbons

Release Date: September 19 2024

A book club novel laced with British humour for those who believe it’s never too late to change. In a quirky world where an organisation mandated with universal happiness is pushed to burnout, meet Mavis and Jeff. Married for fifty years, they have resolutely decided they’re too old to be happy.

Buy on Amazon

The Rhino Keeper

by Jillian Forsberg

Release Date: October 22 2024

Based on the true story of a Dutch sea captain who traveled with an Indian rhinoceros called Clara across 18th century Europe, THE RHINO KEEPER evokes both the thrill of discovery in the archives and the wonder felt by a world in which no European had seen a living rhinoceros.

Buy on Amazon

Chains of Fate

by Melissa Cole

Release Date: September 27 2024

Chains of Fate by Melissa Cole is a gripping tale of resilience, courage, and the relentless pursuit of liberty. As the flames of war engulf a nation, will Thomas Everhart rise as a hero, or will he fall to the unforgiving edge of history?

Buy on Amazon

Night and Day

by John Connolly

Release Date: October 22 2024

Filled with eerie surprises and dark delights, Night and Day takes us from the dusty shelves of an uncanny library filled with fictional characters to a bunker deep beneath the earth.

Buy on Amazon

Mr. O Winds Back the Clock

by I J Baker

Release Date: October 21 2024

IT is crunch time for the fastidious copy editor Seamus Cullen, who decades earlier had lived very differently. Failing at work and required to take leave, he finds solace in memories of his freewheeling twenties, and pursues them back to a present that has subtly altered.
